item.description: A veteran reflects on the fear and courage that defined the D-Day landings.

item.description: A powerful opening set the tone as inspiring stories and unforgettable performances honored American heroes.

item.title: They Made Us HATE David Schwimmer For Band of Brothers and It Worked
item.description: A brilliantly crafted performance turns David Schwimmer into the character everyone loves to despise.

item.title: From Vietnam combat to legendary track coach.
item.description: Hal Croft went from intense fighting in Vietnam to becoming a legendary Reading Memorial High School track coach. Croft’s leadership shepherded in 29 undefeated seasons and shaped generations of students.

item.title: How We Spotted Enemies from a Foxhole
item.description: James Sharp describes the methods soldiers used to detect enemy movement from a foxhole, relying on sharp observation, sound cues, and battlefield awareness.

item.title: Using My .45 Against Japanese Banzai Charge
item.description: What happens when the enemy overwhelms your position? This powerful memoir shares a veteran's story of close-quarters combat and the desperate use of his .45 sidearm to survive a Banzai charge.

item.title: How I Survived Four Different Concentration Camps
item.description: This powerful memoir shares a survivor's unflinching account of the Holocaust. The veteran recounts the physical hardship and mental resilience required to endure four different concentration camps.

item.title: It Was a Miracle I Made It Off Omaha Beach
item.description: Go inside the brutal reality of D-Day. This video documents a soldier's experience navigating the intense fire and obstacles on Omaha Beach, detailing the courage and luck that brought him safely off the sand.

item.title: They Trained For Everything, But That Was Different
item.description: Go inside the reality of a soldier's experience. This powerful memoir documents a time when military training was not enough, detailing the unique challenges and unexpected variables of a difficult mission.

item.title: Soldiers Thought They'd Be Safe Staying in the Landing Craft
item.description: Go inside a high-stakes combat landing. This veteran recounts the critical, early moments of the assault and the profound, deadly shock when the soldiers realized they were exposed inside the landing craft.

item.title: Courage, Sacrifice, and the Battle of the Bulge
item.description: Go inside one of WWII's toughest fights. Veterans share their first-hand accounts of the extreme cold and intense fighting that defined the Battle of the Bulge, revealing the profound cost of courage.

item.title: Flamethrower Combat on IWO JIMA with a WWII MARINE
item.description: Go inside the brutal reality of Iwo Jima. This Marine veteran shares his first-hand account of the terrifying moments and the critical role of flamethrowers in breaking through Japanese defenses.

item.title: We Were Credited With Eliminating an NVA Regiment
item.description: What was the scale of this decisive victory? This powerful memoir shares a veteran’s story of the high-stakes mission that led to their unit being credited with defeating an entire NVA Regiment in combat.

item.title: Meet the Psychologist Behind America's Special Forces
item.description: Who is the psychologist shaping the elite mindset of America's toughest soldiers? This video explores the rigorous selection, mental conditioning, and psychological strategies behind the training of Special Forces.

item.title: Nightfall in Vietnam: Choosing to Dig In for the Night
item.description: Go inside the psychological reality of combat. This video documents a veteran’s experience, detailing the courage and planning required to secure a position and dig in for the night during the Vietnam War.

item.title: My First Steps On Omaha Beach on D-Day
item.description: What was it like to take the first steps on Omaha Beach? This veteran shares his powerful, first-hand account of the landing, detailing the intense fire and courage required during the initial moments of D-Day.

item.title: The Fighting Conditions We Faced in the Pacific
item.description: What was it truly like to fight in the Pacific theater of WWII? This video shares a veteran's powerful, first-hand account of the brutal fighting conditions, detailing the heat, terrain, and challenges faced by soldiers.

item.title: An Easy Company actor reflects on the epic series.
item.description:
Ross McCall, who portrayed Easy Company veteran Joseph Liebgott in HBO’s epic miniseries ‘Band of Brothers’ explains what it meant to be apart of the series.
On November 7 & 8 in Washington, DC, AVC will bring together nearly FORTY living heroes of World War II - plus legends of the last 80 years of history - and you can see it all for FREE!
From D-Day to Iwo Jima. Chosin Reservoir to Ia Drang. The famed ODA 595 ‘Horse Soldiers’ to U.S. Navy SEALs. The AVC’s 28th Annual American Valor Heroes & Legends Conference brings together the greatest living stories of American history, all to share their stories and lessons in a one of a kind Veterans Day special event.
And YOU are invited. Join the full weekend of events, or register to attend the AVC Conference at link here: https://secure.anedot.com/american-veterans-center/avc2025dailyspeakersessions
For questions about the event or how to register, e-mail conference@avcmail.org.

item.title: Blood Was Coming Out of Me Like an Oil Well
item.description: This powerful memoir shares a veteran's unflinching account of being severely wounded in combat. He recounts the urgent fight for survival and the incredible courage required to stay alive under fire.
